info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:05PM CDT until July 29 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Custer.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broken Bow, Callaway, Merna, Oconto, Anselmo, Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, Lillian, Pressey State Wildlife Management Area, Lodi and Buckeye. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING
